item.title: MITRE ATT&CK Matrix
item.description: What is ATT&CK Matrix? ðŸ¤” MITRE ATT&CK Matrix is a visualization method used to classify and see attack methods of cyber attackers. Matrices can be customized for almost any subject and turned into useful visuals.

item.title: MITRE ATT&CK Mitigations
item.description: What are Mitigations? Mitigations refers to the measures and actions that can be taken in response to the techniques in the MITRE ATT&CK matrix. Each mitigation has a unique ID, name and description that provides clear understanding about them.

item.title: MITRE ATT&CK Tactics
item.description: What is Tactic? Tactic expresses the purpose of the cyber attacker and the reason for his action. Tactics are one of the most important MITRE ATT&CK Framework components used to group cyber attacker behaviors and see the attack steps.

item.title: MITRE ATT&CK Technics & Sub-Techniques
item.description: What are Techniques and Sub-Techniques? The tactics within the matrix only show what the attackers aim and do not contain detailed information about the attackerâ€™s attack method ...

item.title: Masquerading
item.description: Masquerading occurs when the name or location of an object, legitimate or malicious, is manipulated or abused for the sake of evading defenses and observation ...

item.title: Network Propagation
item.description: After a device is exploited in a network, the adversary spreads its access through the network. Exploiting more devices in the same network becomes a lot more easier because usually: Credentials to other devices may be insecurely stored on host Host might have exclusive access to other devices such as printers and storages, not open to public Hence, the attacker would set up a base on one of the systems to act as their pivot point and use it to gather information about the internal network.

item.title: OSINT
item.description: Open source intelligence (OSINT) is the act of gathering and analyzing publicly available data for intelligence purposes.

item.title: OWASP
item.description: The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a non-profit foundation dedicated to improving software security. Without a doubt, OWASP is one of the best resources for information on web application security.

item.title: Pass the Hash Attack
item.description: A Pass-the-Hash (PtH) attack is a technique where an attacker captures a password Hash (as opposed to the password characters) and then passes it through for authentication and lateral ...

item.title: Phishing
item.description: Phishing is a form of social engineering and a scam where attackers deceive people into revealing sensitive information or installing malware such as viruses, worms, adware, or ...
